definitions.definition: To obtain (something) for free, particularly by guile or persuasion.
(specifically) To obtain confidential information by impersonation or other deception.
definitions.example: The newspaper is accused of blagging details of Gordon Brown's flat purchase from his solicitors.
He's blagged his way into many a party.

definitions.definition: (1940s) To deceive; to perpetrate a hoax on.
